Column Comment.0: SUBSTANCE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a substance that can be describedeither chemically or in terms of composition. Elements, ions, isotopes, isomers,minerals, chemicals, solvents, production substances, hydrocarbons etc are all listed.Be advised that many applications and agencies may use the same term, but thedefinition and composition details may not be the same. Use the SUBSTANCE XREFtable to capture relationships between substances, such as similar substances.
Column Comment.1: ANALYSIS SOURCE: The source that the analysis came from, this could be a labtechnician, a lab, a company, a government agency, etc.
Column Comment.2: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE OBSERVATION NUMBER: Unique identifier for the recordthat describes the business associate that made the observation regarding thesample analysis.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: REFERENCE ANALYSIS BUSINESS ASSOCIATE ROLE TYPE: the type of role thata business associate plays or may play during a sample analysis. Examples includetechnician, scientist, reviewer, laboratory, conducted for, document preparation etc.
Column Comment.5: CAS NUMBER: A unique numeric identifier for chemicals, alloys and biologicalsequences.
Column Comment.6: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first comes into effect.
Column Comment.7: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row is no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.8: LOCATION: The address or the manufacturer or of the warehouse the substance iscoming from.
Column Comment.9: MANUFACTURER: The name of the manufacturer that has the substance availableor can produce the substance at request.
Column Comment.10: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.11: PRICE: The price of the specified quantity of the substance.
Column Comment.13: PROBLEM INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether or not there is a problem withthe step. If a yes flag is indicated, additional information regarding the problemshould be noted in the table ANL_PROBLEM.
Column Comment.14: QUANTITIES AVAILABLE: The portion quantities that the manufacturer provides thesubstance in. For example the substance may be available in liters, kg, sheets, etc.
Column Comment.16: PURCHASE QUANTITY TYPE: The quantities in which a product or substance canbe purchased, such as 20 pund sack, 10 liter pail, etc.
Column Comment.17: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.18: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.19: STEP SEQUENCE NUMBER: A unique number indicating the sequence of the stepamong other steps in the preparation and processing of the sample. This column is asufficient method to keep track of what is done in the sample analysis. However, ifthe requirement for more complicated tracking such as two steps occurringsimultaneously or if steps are needed to be added to the initial procedure, use thetwo columns STEP_SEQ_NO1 and STEP_SEQ_NO2 in the tableANL_STEP_XREF.
Column Comment.20: SUBSTANCE BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for thebusiness associate who had anything to do with a substance. Track the role playedby the business associate in BA_ROLE. If a BA plays more than one role, create arow for each role played by the BA.
Column Comment.21: SUPPLIER: the name of the company from whom this substance can be obtained
Column Comment.22: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.23: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.24: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.25: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.26: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.27: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.28: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
